name: Concept Note : JARVIS <> RZPX.txt - Introduction
description: This section introduces the concept of enabling Jarviskube automation for RZPX, which involves deploying Jarviskube on RZPX clusters. Jarviskube deployment is a prerequisite for running Kubectl commands on a given cluster. The section suggests two approaches that could be taken for this automation, but does not provide details about these approaches.
use_cases: Running Kubectl commands on RZPX clusters

name: Concept Note : JARVIS <> RZPX.txt - Approaches
description: This section outlines two potential approaches for integrating the RZPX Jarviskube with the existing Jarvis system in the ops-common-cluster. The first approach involves integrating the RZPX Jarviskube directly with the existing Jarvis system, while the second approach involves deploying a new Jarvis deployment in the RZPX cluster with a separate endpoint. The section mentions that approval from the Compliance team is required to determine which approach should be taken, and it concludes by stating that approval has been obtained to proceed with the first approach.
use_cases: Integrating RZPX Jarviskube with the existing Jarvis system in ops-common-cluster
Deploying a new Jarvis deployment in the RZPX cluster with a separate endpoint
Restricting cross-cluster communications to a new endpoint
Obtaining approval from the Compliance team for the chosen approach

name: Concept Note : JARVIS <> RZPX.txt - Compliance Approval
description: This section appears to be empty or missing content. Without any text or information provided, it is difficult to provide a meaningful description or extract any use cases or capabilities.
